text: Bruce Wallrodt, (26 September 1951 â€“ 2 July 2019) was an Australian Paralympic athlete. He competed at five Paralympic Games and won nine medals, four of them gold. He was born in Bunbury, Western Australia. In the 1988 Seoul Games, Wallrodt won two gold medals and a bronze medal in the Men's Discus 2 event. Wallrodt died on 2 July 2019 at the age of 67. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Australian athletes Category:Sportspeople from Western Australia
title: Bruce Wallrodt
